reviewText: I had a good experience with this purchase , It came in a timely manner and the quality was good .Thanks again Bill
Buy this... it reminds one of how truly blessed we are... I love the dogfights and rescues of downed pilots... awesome film!
The price and product were good. The service was excellent. I would purchase from you folks again without hesitation.
This was a very good movie. It makes you realize what the men went through during the war.
This was a good addition to my collection.
A greta ddition to my collection of WWII airplanes.

Nice documentary on the B 17 flying fortress.  Reasonable price.  Footage I had not seen before.  Well worth buying and watching.
Terry Jennrich

If you love the B-17 as much as my grandson and I do you must have this DVD. We sat down and watched it right after it came in.  It is well done and we enjoyed it very much.  If you enjoy the History Channel you will enjoy this DVD.

I saw this program when it was first shown on The Military Channel. Great program, very well done. Interviews, interactive graphics, etc. I've seen a lot of air combat programs and this one included some footage I had never seen before.

Would recommend highly to anyone interested in WW II or air combat.
Good documentary for history buffs and anyone who likes WWII airplanes.  A bargain for the price. Makes a great gift.
Stock footage we've seen many times before. Nothing insightful this time. If I see that european ochard being blown-up one more time I'll squeak!!

I bought this video for my father.  He worked at Lockheed during WWII and assembled B-17's (along with Venturas, P-38s and various other warbirds).  Yes, I know that the B-17 was a Boeing plane--but during the war, the country made good use of ALL relevant manufacturing facilities and there was a lot of 'sharing' of intellecutal property.

Dad loved the video.  Given that 'he was there', I took that as high praise.
